Doc: The representation of the schedule as an offset relative to another schedule. For example, the settlement schedule may be relative to the expiry schedule by an FxForward offset.

Source.Contents:
/#
   The representation of the schedule as an offset relative to another schedule. For example, the settlement schedule may be relative to the expiry schedule by an FxForward offset.
 #/
record FpML5.recordkeeping.FxDateOffset {
  # The FX Offset Convention can be FxSpot or FxForward.
  convention : string

  # The settlement offset to the expiry schedule or the expiry offset to the settlement schedule. It is only specified when the settlement convention is FxForward.
  offset : FpML5.recordkeeping.Period?

  # Indicates whether the settlement schedule is relative to the expiry schedule or the expiry schedule is relative to the settlement schedule.
  relativeTo : FpML5.recordkeeping.FxScheduleReference

}

convention.Doc: The FX Offset Convention can be FxSpot or FxForward.
convention.Name: convention

offset.Doc: The settlement offset to the expiry schedule or the expiry offset to the settlement schedule. It is only specified when the settlement convention is FxForward.
offset.Name: offset

relativeTo.Doc: Indicates whether the settlement schedule is relative to the expiry schedule or the expiry schedule is relative to the settlement schedule.
relativeTo.Name: relativeTo
